intro: Anemopaegma mirandum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth anemopaegma, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate, almost ethereal appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, adding a subtle elegance to its overall form. Native to specific regions of southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is often sought after by botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
